Name: Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type 1
Definition: A Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease characterized by demyelination of the peripheral nerve axons.
Synonym: hereditary motor and sensory neuropathy type 1

Name: Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type 2
Definition: A Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease characterized by abnormalities in the axon of the peripheral nerve cell.
Synonym: hereditary motor and sensory neuropathy type 2

Name: Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type 3
Definition: A Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease that is characterized by motor and sensory peripheral neuropathies caused by demyelination.

Name: Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type 4
Definition: A Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease characterized by demyelinating or axonal abnormalities that has_material_basis_in autosomal recessive inheritance.

Name: Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type X
Definition: A Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease that has_material_basis_in X-linked inheritance of a point mutation in the connexin-32 gene.

Name: Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease intermediate type
Definition: A Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease characterized by motor conduction velocities above and below 38 m/s.

Name: Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type 5
Definition: A Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease that is characterized by pyramidal features including extensor plantar responses
Synonym: hereditary motor and sensory neuropathy with pyramidal features

Name: Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type 6
Definition: A Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease that is characterized by early-onset optic atrophy resulting in progressive visual loss and peripheral axonal sensorimotor neuropathy with highly variable age at onset and severity.
Synonym: hereditary motor and sensory neuropathy type 6

Name: Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease type 7
Definition: A Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease that is characterized by optic atrophy followed by retinitis pigmentosa.
Synonym: hereditary motor and sensory neuropathy type 6
